template.name: AEalInputScalar
template.label: alInputScalar
template.description: Combining these vectors can be useful as building blocks for more complex effects.

attribute.name: input
attribute.label: Input
attribute.description: The scalar from from the shader globals to output. When User is selected, the user data float named in the User name parameter will be output.

attribute.name: userName
attribute.label: User name
attribute.description: Enter the name of a user data float to output.

attribute.name: RMPinputMin
attribute.label: Input min
attribute.description: Sets the minimum input value. Use this to pull values outside of 0-1 into a 0-1 range.

attribute.name: RMPinputMax
attribute.label: Input max
attribute.description: Sets the maximum input value. Use this to pull values outside of 0-1 into a 0-1 range.

attribute.name: RMPcontrast
attribute.label: Contrast
attribute.description: Scales the contrast of the input signal.

attribute.name: RMPcontrastPivot
attribute.label: Pivot
attribute.description: Sets the pivot point around which the input signal is contrasted.

attribute.name: RMPbias
attribute.label: Bias
attribute.description: Bias the signal higher or lower. Values less than 0.5 push the average lower, values higher than 0.5 push it higher.

attribute.name: RMPgain
attribute.label: Gain
attribute.description: Adds gain to the signal, in effect a different form of contrast. Values less than 0.5 increase the gain, values greater than 0.5 decrease it.

attribute.name: RMPoutputMin
attribute.label: Output min
attribute.description: Sets the minimum value of the output. Use this to scale a 0-1 signal to a new range.

attribute.name: RMPoutputMax
attribute.label: Output max
attribute.description: Sets the maximum value of the output. Use this to scale a 0-1 signal to a new range.

attribute.name: RMPclampEnable
attribute.label: Enable
attribute.description: When enabled, will clamp the output to Min-Max.

attribute.name: RMPthreshold
attribute.label: Expand
attribute.description: When enabled, will expand the clamped range to 0-1 after clamping.
